instruction: Wash the basmati or Jeerakasala rice thoroughly and soak it in water for 30 minutes.
title: Soak the Rice

transcript_segments.text: Hello friends, welcome back! Today's recipe is a Biryani recipe. It is a tasty biryani made especially in Malabar areas and for weddings in Kerala. It's very easy to make at home. Let's see how to make it.

instruction: Boil water in a large pot, add salt and whole spices (cardamom, cloves, cinnamon, bay leaf). Add soaked rice and cook until it is 90% done. Drain the rice and set it aside.
title: Cook the Rice

transcript_segments.text: First, for making the rice, we use Jeerakasala (Kaima) rice, which is usually used in Malabar wedding biryanis. Let's boil the water to cook the rice.
250 ml cup rice – for 1 cup of rice, use 1.5 cups of water.
For 2.5 cups of rice, use 4 cups of water. Add salt to taste. I haven't used oil or ghee in this. Add the washed rice when the water is boiling. No need to soak the rice.

After soaking the rice in water for half an hour, add a little more water and salt and cook it well. This is the best method. If you follow this method, there's no need to soak. I kept it closed for about 10 minutes and the rice is well-cooked. Now the rice is ready. Let's prepare the masala.
We don’t need too many ingredients for the masala. First, add sunflower oil.

instruction: Heat oil and 2 tablespoons of ghee in a deep pan. Fry the thinly sliced onions on medium heat until golden brown and crispy.
title: Fry Onions

transcript_segments.text: Add 1 kg beef and 1 big onion.

instruction: Remove half of the fried onions and set them aside for garnishing later.
title: Separate Onions for Garnish

transcript_segments.text: Add 1 kg beef and 1 big onion.

instruction: In the remaining oil, add whole spices (if not already used in rice) and sauté briefly until aromatic.
title: Sauté Whole Spices

transcript_segments.text: Add 1 kg beef and 1 big onion.

instruction: Add ginger-garlic paste and slit green chilies. Sauté until the raw smell disappears.
title: Add Ginger-Garlic and Chilies

transcript_segments.text: Add 1 tbsp ginger garlic paste and 2 tbsp chopped tomatoes. Sauté until the raw smell goes away.

instruction: Add the remaining fried onions back into the pan and sauté for a few minutes until soft and well-mixed.
title: Cook Onions for Masala

transcript_segments.text: Add 1 tbsp ginger garlic paste and 2 tbsp chopped tomatoes. Sauté until the raw smell goes away.

instruction: Add chopped tomatoes, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and coriander powder. Cook until the tomatoes are soft and oil starts separating from the masala.
title: Add Tomatoes and Spices

transcript_segments.text: Add 1½ tbsp garam masala, 1½ tsp turmeric powder, coriander leaves, and pepper powder. Mix well.
Add 1 tsp pepper powder and the cooked beef.

instruction: Lower the heat and stir in the yogurt. Mix well to form a thick gravy base.
title: Add Yogurt

transcript_segments.text: Add 1 tsp pepper powder and the cooked beef.

instruction: Add the chicken pieces. Mix to coat them well with the masala. Cover and cook until the chicken is tender and cooked through.
title: Cook Chicken

transcript_segments.text: Mix the beef well with the masala. If you’ve cooked beef without adding water, use the water released during cooking. The masala should be a bit moist for better taste.
After mixing, cook it for 10 minutes on a low flame. For this biryani, we need to roast some ingredients. Add 3 tbsp of sunflower oil to a pan and roast the ingredients.
Now the masala is ready. We need a little gravy for the masala, otherwise, the biryani won't taste right.

instruction: Uncover and continue to cook until the gravy thickens and clings to the chicken.
title: Reduce Masala

transcript_segments.text: Now the masala is ready. We need a little gravy for the masala, otherwise, the biryani won't taste right.

instruction: Grease the bottom of a heavy-bottomed pot with a little ghee. Spoon in half of the chicken masala as the first layer.
title: Prepare for Layering

transcript_segments.text: Now the masala is ready. We need a little gravy for the masala, otherwise, the biryani won't taste right.
To start the dum, first add a layer of rice. We haven’t added oil to the rice – it was cooked only with salt. Now, add the fried ingredients.

instruction: Add a layer of cooked rice over the chicken. Sprinkle fried onions, chopped mint, coriander leaves, lemon juice, and a drizzle of ghee.
title: Layer Rice and Garnishes

transcript_segments.text: The oil used for frying can be reused here. I used around 3 tbsp oil. Add coriander leaves. If you have pineapple, you can add it now for a unique flavor. Then, add another layer of rice.
After adding rice, pour some ghee on top. We didn’t use ghee earlier, so now add about 2 tbsp of cow’s ghee. Sprinkle some garam masala on top.

instruction: Repeat layering with remaining chicken, rice, and garnishes. Ensure the final layer is rice topped with fried onions and herbs.
title: Repeat Layers

transcript_segments.text: After adding rice, pour some ghee on top. We didn’t use ghee earlier, so now add about 2 tbsp of cow’s ghee. Sprinkle some garam masala on top.
Now, we won’t add anything else. Just dum it. If you can use maida dough to seal it, that’s best. Otherwise, use aluminium foil to seal and dum.

instruction: Seal the lid tightly or use dough to secure the edges, preventing steam from escaping during cooking.
title: Seal the Pot

transcript_segments.text: Now, we won’t add anything else. Just dum it. If you can use maida dough to seal it, that’s best. Otherwise, use aluminium foil to seal and dum.

instruction: Place the pot on low heat or on a preheated griddle (tava) and cook for 20-25 minutes. This slow steaming helps flavors meld beautifully.
title: Dum Cook the Biryani

transcript_segments.text: Dum it for 30 to 40 minutes on the smallest flame.

instruction: In a small pan, heat remaining ghee and fry cashew nuts and raisins until golden.
title: Fry Cashews and Raisins

transcript_segments.text: Dum it for 30 to 40 minutes on the smallest flame.

instruction: Open the biryani pot carefully. Sprinkle the fried cashews and raisins on top. Serve hot with raita, pickle, and pappadam.
title: Garnish and Serve
